author: Barbara Grzincic
title: High court takes up Social Security disability award fee cap case
text:
The U.S. Supreme Court will resolve a split in the federal circuits over how to interpret a statutory cap on attorneys’ fee awards in Social Security disability cases, agreeing on Monday to hear a petition brought by a Florida lawyer.
William Culbertson, who practices in Orlando, is challenging a longstanding interpretation of the Social Security Act’s cap on attorneys’ fees by 11th U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals.
To read the full story on Westlaw Practitioner Insights, click here: bit.ly/2LeTkel
